quest.name: Memento Mori
journal: Timbermaster Beatin is staring at you quite intently.

Gairhard has once again named you as his carpenter of choice and requested that you craft an oak composite bow. Beatin speculates that the bow is for Gairhard himself, and will therefore settle for nothing less than absolute perfection. Craft a quality oak composite bow and present it to the timbermaster.
Despite his best efforts, Beatin is unable to find flaw with your craftsmanship. Thus satisfied, he bids you deliver the bow to Gairhard at the Adders' Nest.

Somewhat surprised by Beatin's presumption, Gairhard explains that the bow you crafted is intended for another archer under his command. The captain still wields the same maple longbow that the timbermaster crafted for him many years ago. Return to the Carpenters' Guild and speak with Beatin.

Beatin displays mixed emotions upon learning that Gairhard still carries his old longbow. He muses on the revelation briefly, before remembering your presence and subsequently dismissing you.

※The next carpenter quest will be available from Beatin upon reaching level 45.
objectives: Present an oak composite bow to Beatin.
Deliver the oak composite bow to Gairhard.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Forename, you minxdevil! If I didn't know better, I'd say Gairhard was smitten with you.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: He's given you another commission─this time for an oak composite bow. In case you were unaware, such a bow can only be wielded by a master archer, with years upon years of experience in the field.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Don't you see? You are to craft a bow for Gairhard himself!

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: You are to give this commission your undivided attention, Forename. While simply crafting an oak composite bow is no small feat, I will not permit you to present anything less than perfection.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Have I made myself clear? Good. Now, go.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Only perfection will suffice, Forename. If you have it, then show me.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Even experienced carpenters can find constructing a composite bow to be a daunting task, given the complexity of the design and the variety of materials required.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: But the resulting product is well worth the price.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: This union of wood, bone, and sinew possesses the power of a self bow more than twice its size.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: This makes it ideal for archers who must travel with minimal supplies and cannot afford to carry heavier equipment.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: No matter how much I search, I cannot find flaw with your craftsmanship. Your materials, your execution...it is all, for want of a better word, perfect.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: It comforts me to know that Gairhard will wield this formidable weapon. Deliver it to him with my blessings.

dialogue.name: GAIRHARD
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename. I believe you have a delivery for me?

dialogue.name: GAIRHARD
dialogue.text: Now this is a fine bow, worthy of the Bowlord himself! The girl will be pleased.

dialogue.name: GAIRHARD
dialogue.text: What's that? Beatin thought this was for me? Oh no, this is for another one of my archers.

dialogue.name: GAIRHARD
dialogue.text: I have a perfectly serviceable bow which has served me for many years. Beatin ought to know─he made it.

dialogue.name: GAIRHARD
dialogue.text: Ah, those were the days. He the young initiate, I the aspiring Serpent. He wasn't always so damn cocksure, you know. Back then, he was full of doubts and questions...

dialogue.name: GAIRHARD
dialogue.text: The maple longbow he made me might not look like much to you, but to me it's the perfect weapon. I intend to use it until the day I die.

dialogue.name: GAIRHARD
dialogue.text: Not that I intend to die any time soon, of course! Now then, I believe I have a delivery of my own to make. If you'll excuse me, Forename.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. Was Gairhard well?

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: What!? He still uses that longbow I made as an initiate?

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: I didn't think he kept it...

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: But a Twin Adder captain deserves a far finer weapon. I should offer to craft him a new one.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: “Until the day I die.” Hmph. What nonsense.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Surely that longbow is no more than a mangled stick at this point. If it were to break during battle, he would only have himself to blame.

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Ugh, but I cannot stand idly by while he... <sigh> No, no, I will give this no more thought. He is an experienced soldier; he would never be so reckless...

dialogue.name: BEATINE
dialogue.text: Oh! I did not realize you were still here, Forename. You may go. I have nothing else for you today.

obj.n: Gone till the Sixth Astral Moon
